intro: Wuerschmittia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Wuerschmittia abyssinica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
